cards.name: Reiver Demon
cards.text:
Flying
When Reiver Demon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: If a creature (such as Clone) enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the copy's "enters-the-battlefield" ability will still trigger as long as you cast that creature spell from your hand.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Reiver Demon comes into play, if you played it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Relic Bane
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life."
cards.flavor: A sword that has seen cowardice in battle exacts the price of honor from its wielder.
cards.originalText: Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life."

cards.name: Slith Bloodletter
cards.text:
Whenever Slith Bloodletter deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Slith Bloodletter.
cards.flavor: Goblins fear the slith, believing they are children banished from the womb of the Steel Mother, deep within Kuldotha.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Slith Bloodletter deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Slith Bloodletter.

cards.name: Spoils of the Vault
cards.text: Choose a card name. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card with that name, then put that card into your hand. Exile all other cards revealed this way, and you lose 1 life for each of the exiled cards.
cards.originalText: Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Remove all other cards revealed this way from the game, and you lose 1 life for each of the removed cards.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"A simple trap in a dark corner of the mind, and their nightmares catch up with them."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Vermiculos
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, Vermiculos gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Mirrodin's artificial environment requires its own predators, scavengers, and senseless forces of nature.
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact comes into play, Vermiculos gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wail of the Nim
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Regenerate each creature you control.
• Wail of the Nim deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Regenerate each creature you control; or Wail of the Nim deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Wall of Blood
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Pay 1 life: Wall of Blood gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Blood is thicker than mortar.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Pay 1 life: Wall of Blood gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Woebearer
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Woebearer deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Fear
Whenever Woebearer deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Wrench Mind
cards.text: Target player discards two cards unless they discard an artifact card.
cards.flavor: What is the sound of one head snapping?

rulings.text: You can discard either one artifact card or two cards which may or may not be artifacts. If you really want to, you can discard two artifact cards.

cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards from his or her hand unless he or she discards an artifact card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Arc-Slogger
cards.text: {R}, Exile the top ten cards of your library: Arc-Slogger deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: A shuffling sound and the smell of ozone follow the slogger as surely as its electric tail.
cards.originalText: {R}, Remove the top ten cards of your library from the game: Arc-Slogger deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Atog
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: On Dominaria, a scavenger. On Mirrodin, a predator.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Confusion in the Ranks
cards.text: Whenever an artifact, creature, or enchantment enters the battlefield, its controller chooses target permanent another player controls that shares a card type with it. Exchange control of those permanents.

rulings.text: The exchange isn't optional. If there is a legal choice, you must make one.
The permanents have to share a permanent type both when the target is chosen and when the ability resolves.

Even though Confusion in the Ranks triggers only when an artifact, creature, or enchantment enters the battlefield, the ability can target a land if the permanent entering the battlefield is an artifact land.
The permanents are exchanged only if they're both on the battlefield when the ability resolves.
Confusion in the Ranks triggers on itself entering the battlefield. If an opponent controls an enchantment, exchange Confusion in the Ranks for that enchantment.

cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact, creature, or enchantment comes into play, its controller chooses target permanent another player controls that shares a type with it. Exchange control of those permanents.

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.
cards.flavor: The goblins have forty-two different words for "ow."

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Electrostatic Bolt
cards.text: Electrostatic Bolt deals 2 damage to target creature. If it's an artifact creature, Electrostatic Bolt deals 4 damage to it instead.
cards.flavor: It's hard to avoid electric shock when the entire plane is metallic.
cards.originalText: Electrostatic Bolt deals 2 damage to target creature. If it's an artifact creature, Electrostatic Bolt deals 4 damage to it instead.

cards.name: Fiery Gambit
cards.text: Flip a coin until you lose a flip or choose to stop flipping. If you lose a flip, Fiery Gambit has no effect. If you win one or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 3 damage to target creature. If you win two or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 6 damage to each opponent. If you win three or more flips, draw nine cards and untap all lands you control.

rulings.text: You must choose a target creature when you cast Fiery Gambit. If that target isn't legal on resolution, Fiery Gambit has no effect and you don't even flip a coin.
You can flip any number of coins (you can even flip more than three), but Fiery Gambit has no effect if you lose any of the flips. You can't continue flipping if you lose a flip.
If you win three flips, Fiery Gambit deals 3 damage to the target creature and 6 damage to each opponent, and you draw nine cards and untap all lands you control.
After each flip, you choose whether to continue flipping.

cards.originalText: Flip a coin until you lose a flip or choose to stop flipping. If you lose a flip, Fiery Gambit has no effect. If you win one or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 3 damage to target creature. If you win two or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 6 damage to each opponent. If you win three or more flips, draw nine cards and untap all lands you control.

cards.name: Fists of the Anvil
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Gron's mind reeled with possibilities, most of which are best left unmentioned.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Forge Armor
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Forge Armor, sacrifice an artifact.
Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Fractured Loyalty
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller gains control of that creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller gains control of enchanted creature. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Goblin Striker
cards.text: First strike, haste
cards.flavor: There's no word in the goblin language for "strategy." Then again, there's no word in the goblin language for "word."
cards.originalText: First strike, haste

cards.name: Grab the Reins
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, you gain control of target creature and it gains haste.
• Sacrifice a creature. Grab the Reins deals damage equal to that creature's power to any target.
Entwine {2}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: If you pay the entwine cost, you can sacrifice the creature you gain control of with Grab the Reins.

If you choose the "sacrifice a creature" mode, you choose the target of the damage on announcement, but don't choose what to sacrifice until resolution. You must sacrifice a creature when Grab the Reins resolves, even if you don't want to. If you don't control any creatures at that time, Grab the Reins deals no damage.
If you cast this with Entwine, you don't get priority in the middle of resolution. You can't steal something, do anything (like attack with it), and then sacrifice it.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Until end of turn, you gain control of target creature and it gains haste; or sacrifice a creature, then Grab the Reins deals damage equal to that creature's power to target creature or player.
Entwine {2}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Incite War
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.
• Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able; or creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Krark-Clan Grunt
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Grunt gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The more weapons a goblin breaks in battle, the more respected he becomes.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Grunt gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Krark-Clan Shaman
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Shaman deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: "What do you mean, we're out of stuff to melt down? Give me your leg."

foreignNames.name: クラーク教のシャーマン

cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Shaman deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Mass Hysteria
cards.text: All creatures have haste.
cards.flavor: The sooner you see the whites of their eyes, the sooner you'll spill the red of their blood.
cards.originalText: All creatures have haste.

cards.name: Megatog
cards.text: Sacrifice an artifact: Megatog gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In an ironic bit of evolution, the megatog's dozens of teeth are mainly ornamental. It prefers swallowing things whole.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an artifact: Megatog gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Molten Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, Molten Rain deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
cards.flavor: When the molten rains fall, entire landscapes melt and flow away in rivulets of fire.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. If that land is nonbasic, Molten Rain deals 2 damage to the land's controller.

cards.name: Ogre Leadfoot
cards.text: Whenever Ogre Leadfoot becomes blocked by an artifact creature, destroy that creature.
cards.flavor: When the goblins need more scrap for the Great Furnace, they simply let the ogres loose and follow in their wake.
cards.originalText: Whenever Ogre Leadfoot becomes blocked by an artifact creature, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Rustmouth Ogre
cards.text: Whenever Rustmouth Ogre deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
cards.flavor: It has an iron stomach. Literally.
cards.originalText: Whenever Rustmouth Ogre deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.

cards.name: Seething Song
cards.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor: Vulshok mana rituals echo the day when the red sun burst through Mirrodin's surface to take its place in the heavens.
cards.originalText: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shrapnel Blast
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: From trinket to trauma.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one artifact to cast this spell; you can't cast it without sacrificing an artifact, and you can't sacrifice additional artifacts.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the artifact you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Slith Firewalker
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: The slith incubate in the Great Furnace's heat, emerging on Mirrodin's surface only when the four suns have aligned overhead.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Spikeshot Goblin
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to any target.
cards.flavor: The path of a goblin shaman is a journey through a thousand ways of hurting people.

rulings.text: Spikeshot Goblin's power is determined as its ability resolves. If Spikeshot Goblin has left the battlefield, use its power as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.name: Trash for Treasure
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Goblins generally have two possessions: one per hand.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Trash for Treasure, sacrifice an artifact.
Return target artifact card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Vulshok Battlemaster
cards.text:
Haste
When Vulshok Battlemaster enters the battlefield, attach all Equipment on the battlefield to it. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
cards.flavor: "I could demonstrate how the leonin sunsplicer works, but then you'd be too dead to buy one."

rulings.text: The enters-the-battlefield effect moves all Equipment onto the Battlemaster, regardless of whether that Equipment was attached to other creatures.
Other players' Equipment is moved onto the Battlemaster as well as your own. This doesn't change who controls the Equipment or who can activate its equip ability to move it onto another creature.
If an Equipment can't equip Vulshok Battlemaster, it isn't attached to the Battlemaster, and it doesn't become unattached (if it's attached to a creature).

foreignNames.name: ヴァルショクの戦場の達人

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Vulshok Battlemaster comes into play, attach all Equipment in play to it. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)

cards.name: Vulshok Berserker
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He experiences every emotion with passion and repays every slight with vengeance.

foreignNames.name: ヴァルショクの狂戦士

cards.originalText: Haste

cards.name: War Elemental
cards.text:
When War Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless an opponent was dealt damage this turn.
Whenever an opponent is dealt damage, put that many +1/+1 counters on War Elemental.
cards.originalText:
When War Elemental comes into play, sacrifice it unless an opponent was dealt damage this turn.
Whenever damage is dealt to an opponent, put that many +1/+1 counters on War Elemental.

cards.name: Battlegrowth
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: "I would gladly die for the forest, but I'm much better at killing for it."
cards.originalText: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Bloodscent
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.flavor: To study the predators of the Tangle, two people are required: one to watch from above, and one to run like hell.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

cards.name: Brown Ouphe
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor: In a strange twist of fate, one of the most annoying creatures in the multiverse was brought to the place where it could cause the most damage.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be countered.)

cards.name: Copperhoof Vorrac
cards.text: Copperhoof Vorrac gets +1/+1 for each untapped permanent your opponents control.
cards.flavor: Like all forest beasts, it lives by one rule: if there's no room to grow, make some.
cards.originalText: Copperhoof Vorrac gets +1/+1 for each untapped permanent your opponents control.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: The deadliest force on Mirrodin isn't the largest organism—it's the smallest.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Deconstruct
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. Add {G}{G}{G}.
cards.flavor: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. Then add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Fangren Hunter
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: Big ones hunt the elves, so the elves hunt the small ones to keep them from getting big.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Glissa Sunseeker
cards.text:
First strike
{T}: Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is equal to the amount of unspent mana you have.
cards.flavor: "There's a secret at the heart of this world, and I will unlock it."

rulings.text: The artifact's converted mana cost must be exactly equal to the amount of mana in your mana pool when the ability resolves. If there's less mana or more mana, the artifact won't be destroyed.
The mana has to be in your mana pool before the ability resolves. The ability doesn't allow you to activate mana abilities while it's resolving.

foreignNames.name: 陽光を求める者グリッサ

cards.originalText:
First strike
{T}: Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is equal to the amount of mana in your mana pool.

cards.name: Groffskithur
cards.text: Whenever Groffskithur becomes blocked, you may return target card named Groffskithur from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: It growls not to threaten, but to summon.
cards.originalText: Whenever Groffskithur becomes blocked, you may return target card named Groffskithur from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hum of the Radix
cards.text: Each artifact spell costs {1} more to cast for each artifact its controller controls.
cards.flavor: The elves learned long ago that anything left here slowly vanishes. Now it is a sacred site where the dead are laid to rest and where unnatural magic is erased forever.
cards.originalText: Each artifact spell costs {1} more to play for each artifact its controller controls.

cards.name: Journey of Discovery
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.
• You may play up to two additional lands this turn.
Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: If you cast an entwined Journey of Discovery using Vedalken Orrery during an opponent's turn, you can't play two lands during that turn.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library; or you may play up to two additional lands this turn.
Entwine {2}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Living Hive
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Living Hive deals combat damage to a player, create that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
cards.flavor: In its center is a single red ant, a queen that regulates the hive's movements.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Living Hive deals combat damage to a player, put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Molder Slug
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact.
cards.flavor: Fortunately for it, Mirrodin is a plane without salt.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact.

cards.name: One Dozen Eyes
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Create a 5/5 green Beast creature token.
• Create five 1/1 green Insect creature tokens.
Entwine {G}{G}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Put a 5/5 green Beast creature token into play; or put five 1/1 green Insect creature tokens into play.
Entwine {G}{G}{G} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Plated Slagwurm
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: Beneath the Tangle, the wurm tunnels stretch . . . wide as a stone's throw, long as forever, deep as you dare.
cards.originalText: Plated Slagwurm can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.

cards.name: Predator's Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If you hear it coming, you're not its prey.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Slith Predator
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Slith Predator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Born amid the molten metal of the Great Furnace, the slith have more than adapted to the perils of a metal world.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Slith Predator deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Sylvan Scrying
cards.text: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: One glimpse of an elf's home lasts her weeks away in the wild.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Tel-Jilad Archers
cards.text: Protection from artifacts; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: They are extensions of the Tangle, stretching its vines into the furthest reaches of the sky.
cards.originalText:
Protection from artifacts
Tel-Jilad Archers may block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Tel-Jilad Chosen
cards.text: Protection from artifacts
cards.flavor: "It is my honor to keep safe Tel-Jilad's secrets, not to know them."

foreignNames.name: テル＝ジラードに選ばれし者

cards.originalText: Protection from artifacts

cards.name: Tel-Jilad Exile
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Tel-Jilad Exile.
cards.flavor: For his crimes, he was made to forget all the trolls' secrets. Now he knows only that he is outcast, but not why.

foreignNames.name: テル＝ジラードの流刑者

cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Regenerate Tel-Jilad Exile.

cards.name: Tooth and Nail
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for up to two creature cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.
• Put up to two creature cards from your hand onto the battlefield.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Search your library for up to two creature cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library; or put up to two creature cards from your hand into play.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Troll Ascetic
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.
cards.flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.
cards.originalText:
Troll Ascetic can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

cards.name: Trolls of Tel-Jilad
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate target green creature.
cards.flavor: "The secret of this world weighs upon us, and we have been shaped by time and duty to bear it."

foreignNames.name: テル＝ジラードのトロール

cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Regenerate target green creature.

cards.name: Turn to Dust
cards.text: Destroy target Equipment. Add {G}.
cards.flavor: Mirrodin's inhabitants must be prepared for anything—including suddenly being unprepared.
cards.originalText: Destroy target Equipment. Then add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Viridian Joiner
cards.text: {T}: Add an amount of {G} equal to Viridian Joiner's power.
cards.flavor: "The Tangle reaches out to itself constantly, forming new connections. We must follow its example."

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンの社交家

cards.originalText: {T}: Add an amount of {G} to your mana pool equal to Viridian Joiner's power.

cards.name: Viridian Shaman
cards.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Because the elves are so in touch with Mirrodin's nature, they understand best how to dismantle it.

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンのシャーマン

cards.originalText: When Viridian Shaman comes into play, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Wurmskin Forger
cards.text: When Wurmskin Forger enters the battlefield, distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures.
cards.flavor: It takes three weeks for a patrol of hunters to down a slagwurm. It takes just as long to make a single cut in its hide.
cards.originalText: When Wurmskin Forger comes into play, distribute three +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Aether Spellbomb
cards.text:
{U}, Sacrifice Aether Spellbomb: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
{1}, Sacrifice Aether Spellbomb: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Release that which was never caged."
—Spellbomb inscription
cards.originalText:
{U}, Sacrifice Æther Spellbomb: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
{1}, Sacrifice Æther Spellbomb: Draw a card.

cards.name: Alpha Myr
cards.flavor: First to charge, first to fight.

cards.name: Altar of Shadows
cards.text:
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} for each charge counter on Altar of Shadows.
{7}, {T}: Destroy target creature. Then put a charge counter on Altar of Shadows.

rulings.text: The precombat main phase is the first main phase of the turn. All others are postcombat main phases, even if they technically occur before combat.
You put the counter on Altar of Shadows even if the creature regenerates.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {B} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Altar of Shadows.
{7}, {T}: Destroy target creature. Then put a charge counter on Altar of Shadows.

cards.name: Banshee's Blade
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each charge counter on Banshee's Blade.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage, put a charge counter on Banshee's Blade.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

rulings.text: The counters stay on Banshee's Blade even if it becomes unattached, or moves from one creature to another.

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each charge counter on Banshee's Blade.
Whenever equipped creature deals combat damage, put a charge counter on this card.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card comes into play unattached and stays in play if the creature leaves play.)

cards.name: Blinkmoth Urn
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, if Blinkmoth Urn is untapped, that player adds {C} for each artifact they control.
cards.flavor: The vedalken embed such urns in their living artifact creations.

rulings.text: The precombat main phase is the first main phase of the turn. All others are postcombat main phases, even if they technically occur before combat.
The "precombat main phase" is the first main phase of the turn. All other main phases are "postcombat main phases."

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, if Blinkmoth Urn is untapped, that player adds {1} to his or her mana pool for each artifact he or she controls.

cards.name: Bonesplitter
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Equip {1}
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card comes into play unattached and stays in play if the creature leaves play.)

cards.name: Bosh, Iron Golem
cards.text:
Trample
{3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to any target.
cards.flavor: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets buried deep in his memory.

foreignNames.name: 鉄のゴーレム、ボッシュ

cards.originalText:
Trample
{3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to target creature or player.

cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Cathodion
cards.text: When Cathodion dies, add {C}{C}{C}.
cards.flavor: Cathodions repair the Great Furnace by soldering parts of themselves to the mechanism. Eventually, they become one with the machine.

rulings.text: The ability is never a mana ability.
You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

cards.originalText: When Cathodion is put into a graveyard from play, add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Chalice of the Void
cards.text:
Chalice of the Void enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Chalice of the Void, counter that spell.

rulings.text: A mana cost of {X}{X} means that you pay twice X. If you want X to be 3, you pay {6} to cast Chalice of the Void.

The number of counters on Chalice of the Void matters only at the time the spell is cast. Changing the number of charge counters on Chalice of the Void after a spell has been cast won't change whether the ability counters the spell.
If there are zero charge counters on Chalice of the Void, it counters each spell with a converted mana cost of 0. This includes face-down creature spells cast with morph's alternative cost.

Chalice of the Void has to be on the battlefield at the end of casting a spell for the ability to trigger. If you sacrifice Chalice of the Void as a cost to cast a spell, its ability can't trigger. However, if it leaves the battlefield once its ability has triggered, that ability will still counter the spell.

cards.originalText:
Chalice of the Void comes into play with X charge counters on it.
Whenever a player plays a spell with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Chalice of the Void, counter that spell.

cards.name: Chromatic Sphere
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Sphere: Add one mana of any color. Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"As expected, this sphere's design reflects the colors of the four moons . . . plus another?"
—Pontifex, elder researcher

rulings.text: This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Sphere: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card.

cards.name: Chrome Mox
cards.text:
Imprint — When Chrome Mox enters the battlefield, you may exile a nonartifact, nonland card from your hand.
{T}: Add one mana of any of the exiled card's colors.

rulings.text: If no card is imprinted on Chrome Mox, it can't add mana to your mana pool. It can never add colorless mana to your mana pool, even if the imprinted card has a colorless mana symbol in its mana cost.
If you imprinted a multicolored card, you choose one of that card's colors each time Chrome Mox's ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Imprint When Chrome Mox comes into play, you may remove a nonartifact, nonland card in your hand from the game. (The removed card is imprinted on this artifact.)
{T}: Add one mana of any of the imprinted card's colors to your mana pool.

cards.name: Clockwork Beetle
cards.text:
Clockwork Beetle enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Clockwork Beetle attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.

cards.originalText:
Clockwork Beetle comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Clockwork Beetle attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.

Whenever Clockwork Condor attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.

Flying

Trample
Clockwork Vorrac enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Clockwork Vorrac attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Clockwork Vorrac.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Clockwork Vorrac comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Clockwork Vorrac attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it at end of combat.
{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Clockwork Vorrac.

cards.name: Cobalt Golem
cards.text: {1}{U}: Cobalt Golem gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Centuries before the first tides of the Quicksilver Sea rose to meet each new sun, Mirrodin's light shone on the golems alone.
cards.originalText: {1}{U}: Cobalt Golem gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Copper Myr
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: The elves thought of the myr as minor threats, just as the myr thought of the elves.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Crystal Shard
cards.text: {3}, {T} or {U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: The vedalken know it is not of this world, so they know that this world is not the only one.

rulings.text: You can pay either of the two costs (but not both at the same time) to activate the ability.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T} or {U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Culling Scales
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target nonland permanent with the lowest converted mana cost. (If two or more permanents are tied for lowest cost, target any one of them.)

rulings.text: You choose the target. If there's more than one nonland permanent tied for lowest converted mana cost, you choose which one to target.
If the targeted permanent doesn't have the lowest converted mana cost when the ability resolves, the ability doesn't resolve and the permanent isn't destroyed.
Most tokens have a converted mana cost of 0. A token that's a copy of another permanent or card has a converted mana cost equal to that permanent or card's converted mana cost.
If the lowest converted mana cost is 3, Culling Scales can destroy itself.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target nonland permanent with the lowest converted mana cost among nonland permanents in play. (If two or more permanents are tied for lowest cost, target any one of them.)

cards.name: Damping Matrix
cards.text: Activated abilities of artifacts and creatures can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.
cards.flavor: The priests tried cursing it. The mages tried dispelling it. In the end, they all obeyed it.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keyword abilities, such as equip, are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.
A mana ability is an ability that produces mana, not an ability that costs mana.

Damping Matrix's ability affects only artifacts and creatures on the battlefield. Activated abilities that work in other zones (such as bloodrush or unearth) can still be activated. Triggered abilities (starting with "when," "whenever," or "at") are unaffected.

cards.originalText: Activated abilities of artifacts and creatures can't be played unless they're mana abilities.

cards.name: Dead-Iron Sledge
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy both creatures.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

rulings.text: Moving Dead-Iron Sledge after the ability triggers will not affect which creatures are destroyed.

cards.originalText:
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature and equipped creature.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card comes into play unattached and stays in play if the creature leaves play.)

cards.name: Dragon Blood
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: A single drop turns skin to scale and fist to claw.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Dross Scorpion
cards.text: Whenever Dross Scorpion or another artifact creature dies, you may untap target artifact.
cards.flavor: They skitter out of the mists to consume fresh kill before Mephidross has a chance to corrode it away.
cards.originalText: Whenever Dross Scorpion or another artifact creature is put into a graveyard from play, you may untap target artifact.

cards.name: Duplicant
cards.text:
Imprint — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
As long as a card exiled with Duplicant is a creature card, Duplicant has the power, toughness, and creature types of the last creature card exiled with Duplicant. It's still a Shapeshifter.

rulings.text: If no creature card is imprinted on Duplicant, it has its normal power, toughness, and creature type.
Duplicant's base power and toughness change to the imprinted card's power and toughness. Counters and other effects that modify Duplicant's power and toughness still apply.

Abilities that define a creature's power and toughness apply while that card is in exile, but abilities that add or subtract from it don't. For example, the ability of Battle Squadron applies to determine Duplicant's power and toughness, but the ability of Werebear doesn't. Duplicant's power and toughness are constantly updated if the exiled card's power and/or toughness change.
Duplicant keeps all creature types it had when the card was imprinted, including any types that Duplicant had gained.

If a melded permanent is exiled by Duplicant's triggered ability, that ability's controller chooses the relative timestamp of the two meld cards. Duplicant looks at the information of the one with the later timestamp.

cards.originalText:
Imprint When Duplicant comes into play, you may remove target nontoken creature from the game. (The removed card is imprinted on this artifact.)
As long as a creature card is imprinted on Duplicant, Duplicant has that card's power, toughness, and creature types. It's still a Shapeshifter.

cards.name: Duskworker
cards.text:
Whenever Duskworker becomes blocked, regenerate it.
{3}: Duskworker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: At the setting of each sun, it emerges to clean Mirrodin's floor of the day's carrion.

rulings.text: Setting up the regeneration shield doesn't remove Duskworker from combat. However, Duskworker is removed from combat if it would be destroyed and then regenerates.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Duskworker becomes blocked, regenerate it.
{3}: Duskworker gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elf Replica
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Elf Replica: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: It hunts with unnerving ferocity.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Elf Replica: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Empyrial Plate
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand.
Equip {2}
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card comes into play unattached and stays in play if the creature leaves play.)

cards.name: Extraplanar Lens
cards.text:
Imprint — When Extraplanar Lens enters the battlefield, you may exile target land you control.
Whenever a land with the same name as the exiled card is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any type that land produced.
cards.originalText:
Imprint When Extraplanar Lens comes into play, you may remove target land you control from the game. (The removed card is imprinted on this artifact.)
Whenever a land with the same name as the imprinted card is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.name: Farsight Mask
cards.text: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, if Farsight Mask is untapped, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: It turns the adversity of the moment into the knowledge of a lifetime.

rulings.text: This triggers each time a source an opponent controls deals damage to you. If the same source deals damage more than once in a turn, it triggers for each of those times.
You draw no more than one card each time a source an opponent controls damages you, no matter how much damage the source deals.
Farsight Mask must be untapped both when the damage is dealt and when you would draw the card.
Each instance of each creature's combat damage is counted separately. If three creatures with double strike attack you and all of them are unblocked, you may draw up to six cards.

cards.originalText: Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, if Farsight Mask is untapped, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Fireshrieker
cards.text:
Equipped creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card comes into play unattached and stays in play if the creature leaves play.)

cards.name: Frogmite
cards.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
cards.flavor: At first, vedalken observers thought blinkmoths naturally avoided certain places. Then they realized those places were frogmite feeding grounds.
cards.originalText: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)

cards.name: Galvanic Key
cards.text:
Flash
{3}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
cards.flavor: A solution in search of a problem.
cards.originalText:
You may play Galvanic Key any time you could play an instant.
{3}, {T}: Untap target artifact.

cards.name: Gate to the Aether
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player reveals the top card of their library. If it's an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card, the player may put it onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card, the player may put it into play.
